alert.note: Alert for Canadian; Cleveland; Garvin; Grady; McClain; Oklahoma; Stephens (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 8:41AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Garvin, Grady, western Oklahoma, northern Stephens, northwestern Cleveland, southeastern Canadian and McClain Counties through 915 AM CDT... At 841 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mustang to near Tabler to 6 miles east of Rush Springs to 4 miles southwest of Bray. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, Norman, southern Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Duncan, Del City, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Purcell, Marlow, Yukon, Bethany, Mustang, Warr Acres, The Village, Noble, Tuttle and Spencer. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 90 and 139. Interstate 40 between mile markers 136 and 161. Interstate 44 between mile markers 75 and 141. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Canadian; Cleveland; Garvin; Grady; McClain; Oklahoma; Stephens
